byline.contributor: Jack Healy contributed reporting from the Panjshir Valley, Afghanistan, and Sharifullah Sahak from Kabul.

abstract: NATO officials in Afghanistan say they have reversed momentum of Taliban insurgency as enemy attacks are falling for first time in years; it is most optimistic assessment yet from senior NATO officials, and runs counter to dimmer appraisals from some Afghan officials and other international agencies.
snippet: With enemy attacks falling in Afghanistan for the first time in years, NATO officials said they had reversed the Taliban insurgency’s momentum.
lead_paragraph: With enemy attacks falling in Afghanistan for the first time in years, NATO officials said they had reversed the Taliban insurgency’s momentum.

headline.main: NATO Assessment Emphasizes Setbacks for Taliban
headline.print_headline: Contrary to Gloomier Assessments, NATO’s View Emphasizes Setbacks for Taliban
headline.seo: NATO Assessment Says Taliban Attacks Are Down
